title: 107_hr2161
content: The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 may be cited as the "Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act." It includes a mandatory fuel surcharge provision. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001, also known as the "Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act," includes a mandatory fuel surcharge provision for truckload transportation services. This provision requires a minimum surcharge for fuel used in transportation when the current fuel price exceeds a set benchmark by $0.05 per gallon. The surcharge is to be assessed by motor carriers, brokers, or freight forwarders based on mileage or a percentage of the transportation charges. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 mandates a fuel surcharge for truckload transportation services, calculated based on mileage or revenue percentage. The benchmark price is $1.10 per gallon. The surcharge is to be calculated upon shipment tender, itemized on invoices, and paid by the transportation charges payer. Factors for calculation include an average fuel economy of 5 miles per gallon. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 mandates a fuel surcharge for truckload transportation services based on mileage or revenue percentage. The surcharge is calculated using an average fuel economy of 5 miles per gallon. Enforcement of this section is through private right of action, and neither the Secretary of Transportation nor the Surface Transportation Board has regulatory authority over it. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 allows for fuel cost adjustments in transportation contracts, including privately negotiated provisions to compensate for fuel price increases. This provision does not limit the ability to enter into contracts with fuel adjustments after the enactment of the Act. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 allows for fuel cost adjustments in transportation contracts, including provisions to compensate for fuel price increases. Section 13714 requires this adjustment, with a clerical amendment to the analysis for chapter 137 of the title. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 includes provisions for fuel surcharge and negotiated fuel adjustments, with a mandatory pass-through to the cost bearer. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 mandates that motor carriers, brokers, or freight forwarders pass through fuel surcharges to the responsible party and disclose all relevant charges in writing. The Motor Carrier Fuel Cost Equity Act of 2001 requires the intentional reduction of compensatory transportation costs to adjust for fuel surcharges and limits enforcement to private right of action. Surface Transportation Board does not have regulatory or enforcement authority related to provisions of this subsection.
